edge: The film's writing and production team wanted Norm to be like Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer, much like how Rudolph perceived his red nose as a disadvantage for him but later helped Santa a lot, Norm sees his ability to communicate with humans as a negative, but it later ultimately saves the Arctic from Mr. Greene.
Schneider was cast by the producers for the role of Norm due to his 'vocal warmth and spot-on comedic instincts'.

The producers 'immediately fell in love with Robâ€™s voice. His vocal dexterity was amazing. He also did a great job of embellishing lines to make them funnier. Many of those ad-libs made it into the film'.
Other bears look at Norm that way.
actress Heather Graham was chosen to play the role of Vera Brightly in Norm of the North due to her performance being described as 'fierce but sensitive at the same time' during auditions.
Ken Jeong was chosen to voice Mr. Greene in Norm of the North due to his ability to be both villainous and likable at the same time, as well as his comic timing and subtext in his voice.

Kay previously did voice acting for another animated film by Lionsgate, Alpha and Omega (2010). She enjoyed voicing the character Olympia Brightly in this film as well and found it awesome to play a smart character with good intentions.
Kay was super excited to have Heather Graham play her mom in the film, just like Vera, she's one of the sweetest people you'll ever meet.
McElhatton played the character Laurence in this film.
Corden also played the character Laurence, but in a different version of the film.
In this context, Nick Shakoour is portraying the character of Costumed Bear.
Max Spitz is playing the role of Teen Bear #1 in this context.
Janet Varney is portrayed as Janet in this context.
In this context, Rick D. Wasserman is enacting the character of Henchman #3.
As per this context, James Corden is essaying the role of Employee #1.
Although not credited in the source, director Trevor Wall has lent his voice to the three principal lemmings in this context.
